pr_title: [BEAM-9041, BEAM-9042] SchemaCoder equals should not rely on from/toRowFunction equality

timeline.bodyText: Couldn't you just implement equals here instead of changing to comparing byte equality of the serialized function in SchemaCoder?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: This is a second different issue about capture of Avro schema on serialization (the key change is the transient part) so not really related to equals. As explained above I put both together because I use equality to validate the roundtrip of serialization/deserialization.
replies.author: iemejia

timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -102,7 +102,8 @@ protected SchemaCoder( /** * Returns a {@link SchemaCoder} for the specified class. If no schema is registered for this - * class, then throws {@link NoSuchSchemaException}. + * class, then throws {@link NoSuchSchemaException}. The parameter functions to convert from and + * to Rows must implement the equals contract.

timeline.bodyText: I'm not 100% sure but it looks like the failures are occurring when avroSchema is null. Either way I think you need to check if avroSchemaAsString is null here.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: Yes you are right I forgot to check the nullability of the string before the parse, I will fix that and add a method for this. Hopefully everything will be green at that moment. Thanks for the hint.
replies.author: iemejia

timeline.message: [BEAM-9041] Add missing equals methods for GenericRecord <-> Row conversion
[BEAM-9042] Update SchemaCoder doc with info about functions requiring equals
[BEAM-9042] Test serializability and equality of Row<->GenericRecord functions
[BEAM-9042] Test serializability and equality of Row<->GenericRecord functions
